de.tub.data.dao
Class Neo4JUserDAO

java.lang.Object
  de.tub.data.dao.Neo4JUserDAO
All Implemented Interfaces:
IDao, IUserDAO<org.neo4j.graphdb.Node>, Cloneable
public class Neo4JUserDAO
extends Object
implements IUserDAO<org.neo4j.graphdb.Node>, Cloneable

This class gives the possibility to access a user. It hides the technology of access so that the programmer does not have to worry about during usage. The Neo4JUserDAO class is part of the Data Access Object design pattern. That is why it implements the IUserDAO interface with all its methods.
Furthermore it implements the interface Clonable. This makes it possible to clone an instance of Neo4JUserDAO and makes this class a part of the Prototype design pattern.

Author:
Sebastian Oelke

Constructor Detail

Neo4JUserDAO

public Neo4JUserDAO()
Standard empty constructor.

Neo4JUserDAO

public Neo4JUserDAO(Neo4JUserDAO userDao)
Copy constructor for use with the Prototype design pattern. If you use clone() this constructor has to be used and all instance variables have to be copied.
Because the Neo4JUserDAO class has no instance variables to copy this constructor is equivalent with the standard constructor.

Parameters:
userDao - The Neo4JUserDAO which has to be copied.
See Also:
clone()
